game.name: Toads and Frogs Puzzle
game.board: Toads and Frogs is played on a 1-by-N grid.
game.pieces: There are X toads and Y frogs (X+Yâ‰¤N). At the beginning of the puzzle, the toads occupy the leftmost X slots of the grid, the frogs occupy the rightmost Y slots of the grid, and the other slots are empty.[img src="toadsandfrogspuzzle.svg" alt="t" width="300" height="150"]
game.tomove: Toads move to the right and frogs move to the left.[br]A toad may move to the right one space if that space is unoccupied. If one space to the right of a toad there is a frog, and two spaces to the right of the toad there is an unoccupied slot, then the toad may hop over the frog into the unoccupied slot.[br]A frog may move to the left one space if that space is unoccupied. If one space to the left of a frog there is a toad, and two spaces to the left of the frog there is an unoccupied slot, then the frog may hop over the toad into the unoccupied slot.
game.rules: The puzzle is solved after the frogs and toads are moved so that the frogs occupy the leftmost Y spaces and the toads occupy the rightmost X spaces.
